lesson_subtitle: Least Common Multiple and Greatest Common Factor
lesson_description: In this lesson, students continue to expand their understanding of factors, multiples, common factors, and common multiples.‚Äã They use greatest common factors (GCF) and least common multiples (LCM) to solve problems.
learning_goals: I can determine the greatest common factor of two whole numbers and use it to solve problems.
I can determine the least common multiple of two whole numbers and use it to solve problems.
essential_ideas: Number relationships are useful in solving problems in context.
Common factors help determine how to divide or share things equally.
Common multiples help determine how things with different cycles can occur at the same time.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: We Have That in Common
lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.description: Students analyze word problems to determine whether they need to use the GCF or the LCM to solve them.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: Using GCF and LCM to Solve Problems
lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.description: Students apply GCF or LCM to solve problems related to real-world situations.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: LCM and GCF Number Search
lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.description: Students play a game to identify chains of numbers that end with their GCF or LCM.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: Finishing Where We Started
lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.description: Students apply strategies to calculate the GCF or LCM to solve problems.

materials_needed: Instructions for LCM and GCF Number Search (1 per pair)
LCM and GCF Number Search Gameboard (1 per pair)
